definition: ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
(coll.) to look every bit the big star

sentences.english: He was also a reckless adventurer who got lucky.
sentences.chinese: 同時他也是一位輕率魯莽而運氣十足的冒險家。

sentences.english: The Biancocelesti are the runaway leaders at the top of Serie A and confidence is high at Formello.
sentences.chinese: 目前拉齊奧正在積分榜上領跑，球隊信心十足。

sentences.english: I always said she was an awful fool.
sentences.chinese: 我一直就說她是十足的糊塗蟲。

sentences.english: He is riding high now, but I think this won’t be long.
sentences.chinese: 他現在神氣十足，但我認爲不會長久如此。

sentences.english: One of the game's big selling points is its action-oriented movement.
sentences.chinese: 這款遊戲的最大的賣點在於動感十足。

sentences.english: December rabbit meat is characterized by tender meat and delicious food are not Seya, preserved meat full.
sentences.chinese: 臘兔肉的特點是肉嫩味美，食不塞牙，臘味十足。

sentences.english: My boss is a stuffed shirt, bragging all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我的老闆神氣十足，整天在吹噓。

sentences.english: She is a regular boxer in petticoats.
sentences.chinese: 她是個十足的巾幗拳擊家。
你真是一個十足的幽默家。

sentences.english: After ten years in the city, he is still country.
sentences.chinese: 他在城裏待了十年，仍是鄉氣十足。

sentences.english: A suave charmer, he had a reputation for living fast.
sentences.chinese: 他本人魅力十足，生活放蕩不羈。

sentences.english: The commune members went at the building of a dam with a will.
sentences.chinese: 社員們幹勁十足地建築一道堤壩。

sentences.english: It was hard work, but everybody went at it with a will.
sentences.chinese: 勞動很艱苦，可是大家幹勁十足。

sentences.english: statutory debt limit as early as March 31, and newlyemboldened Republican lawmakers intend to use the need to raise it as leveragefor spending cuts.
sentences.chinese: 底氣十足的共和黨議員打算靠提高它來削減開支。

definition: (neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
off the charts/extreme/beyond the normal range of measurement
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
